Name: hydrogen sulfide production | hydrogen sulfide | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Hydrogen sulfide can be either produced by a chemical reaction – e.g. between sulfur and hydrogen, sulfur and hydrocarbons or sulfides and dilute acid – but it can also be recovered from natural gas or refinery gases. This inventory models the use of sulfur recovered from refinery gases, which is melted and then processed into hydrogen sufide.;Reference:;Hischier R., Classen M., Lehmann M. and Scharnhorst W. (2007) Life cycle inventories of Electric and Electronic Equipment: Production, Use and Disposal. ecoinvent report No. 18. Empa / Technology & Society Lab, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Dübendorf, 2007.;Pouliquen, F., Blanc, C., Arretz, E., Labat, I., Tournier-Lasserve, J., Ladousse, A., Nougayrede, J., Savin, G., Ivaldi, R., Nicolas, M., Fialaire, J., Millischer, R., Azema, C., Espagno, L., Hemmer, H. and Perrot, J. 2000. Hydrogen Sulfide. Ullmann's Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry.
